alert.note: Alert for Badlands Area; Butte County Area; Custer County Plains; Fall River County Area; Pine Ridge Area; West Central Plains (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 22 at 2:40AM MDT until July 22 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 314, 315, 316, 317, 322, 325, 326, 327, 329, AND 332... .Hot temperatures rising the upper 90s to lower 100s will combine with very dry air, supporting minimum relative humidity of 8-15% this afternoon. Southwest to southeast winds will increase to 15-25mph with gusts to 30 mph. The combination will support critical fire weather conditions today. Isolated thunderstorms with very little rainfall will be possible in the late afternoon and early evening. Later tonight, winds will shift northwest behind a cold front, gusting over 40 mph in some areas. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 322, 325, 326, 327, 329, AND 332... The National Weather Service in Rapid City has issued a Red Flag Warning for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 10 AM this morning to 10 PM MDT this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 322 Fall River County Area, 325 Custer County Plains, 326 Pine Ridge Area, 327 Butte County Area, 329 West Central Plains and 332 Badlands Area. * WINDS...South to southeast increasing to 15-25 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 11 percent. * LIGHTNING...Isolated dry thunderstorms will be possible in the early evening. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidity would produce critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A red flag warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Badlands Area; Butte County Area; Custer County Plains; Fall River County Area; Pine Ridge Area; West Central Plains
